name: klaus
text: Pat secretly loves Bono.

name: straw
text: I'm not super-sure that it's secret.

name: draykid
text: "super-sure" is the cherry on the top of this ever-so-slightly snarky comment.

name: belgand
text: In time we would come to realize the fullness of this truth

name: geysershitdick
text: Pat is extremely concerned about what Bono will think.

name: bigtom
text: the thought of upsetting Bono is the worst feeling Pat can have

name: oldhusky
text: Bono is going to be very disappointed that Pat completely misread Foucault

name: unsentletter
text:
Pat is extremely concerned about what Bono will think.

Yes. And it looks like this thought puts The Fear in Pat's mind.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
oh, so not like this then?
[IMGS OFF]

name: wehavemagnums
text: I think Pat has a huge package for Bono too IF YOU CATCH MY DRIFT

name: cleave
text: I don't! NoooOOOO!!

name: dumase
text:
I gave you a chubby because at first i thought your name might also be Pat.
But now i see that you just didn't catch his drift.

UN-COOL.

name: epicurus
text: Word up to the Foucault reference.

name: sargasm
text: Natch.  I think the best part is that the radio station has a special sound effect for Pat talking about Foucault.

name: mr2tyler
text: I had a friend in undergrad who went through this phase.  She needed a special Michel Foucault whistle.  It would have warned the rest of us to stop listening.

name: spinynorman
text:
I knew a kid who used to carry around a Foucault book constantly. Never saw the bookmark move.

I guess he thought it would get him wicked ass. If it did I never saw it.

name: epicurus
text: You don't want the ass that Foucault will get you.

name: spinynorman
text: Even if it's wicked ass?

name: epicurus
text: We talking like bouncy Dominican mamacitas or Witch of the West here?

name: spinynorman
text:
When I visualize "wicked ass," it usually comes with a significant tramp stamp whose pattern uses a lot of thorns and letters with sharp fonts. Something like "GREEN WITH ENVY" with a briar patch of ink framing it. The sort of girl who will bite you while making out and break one of your lamps later, presumably intentionally.

I miss you, Melissa. Please call.

name: jlynes
text: chubby this man

name: tekende
text:
I chubbied him

I chubbied this man

name: straw
text: For some reason I found this comment hilarious, and I'm not just saying that because we're Acheworld BFF or something.

name: tekende
text: That's great because it's not my joke. Someone else did it somewhere in the archives and I thought it was histerical.

name: spinynorman
text:
As a matter of fact, I think it was in reponse to me.

Yep. http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/one_strip?b=M%5ea11f09b8576e606bcb5038dfdb92fb821&u=http%3A%2F%2Fachewood.com%2Fcomic.php%3Fdate%3D01072008

I am completely not going to bother sifting through my inbox and sent messages for the exact comment URL, sorry guys, I am just not that much of a trooper. Had too much wine last night to want to sit up in my chair for that long.

name: epicurus
text: I demand that you make some self-deprecating comment regarding the fact that you traced that reference. You may begin now.

name: doomchild
text:
Drinking won't bring her back, man.

DC

name: cpnglxynchos
text: hey! don't you knock?

name: atticusonline
text: You better believe I chubbied this man, Philippe

name: haruspex
text: I chubby this man as his father!

name: aliiis
text:
he is a good man, and chubbable

(I chubbied both these men)

name: pie4me6
text: Your avatar tells us exactly who to chubby.

name: maximus
text: Pat's Wicked Ass. Heh

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Rod's secret name.

name: soticoto
text: Carrying around H.P.Lovecraft books has got quite a few pints bought for me. After that started, I stopped reading them anywhere OTHER than the pub.

name: wrmeade
text: My favorite is how it is the exact opposite of what Foucault would say, not just in one way, but in like four ways.

name: craigola
text: I bet Bono is all over that Monarchical Punishment shit. In secret, of course.

name: havenless
text: I love how the dude already knows its Pat after just one sentence.

name: bozendoka
text: Agreed.  Also that Pat references Foucalt so often that the MC calls it the F-bomb and knows when it's coming.

name: luckyg
text: Bono would NOT approve.

name: bono
text: Are you kidding me?! Pat is my fuckin homie.

name: _cheesekayke
text: Setting up an entirely new account, with picture, just to reply? Well-played, sir.

name: stuart
text:
Bono, according to his profile, is an old lady.

Achtung, baby.

name: zeal
text: But he's viewed 17 strips. Could it be... the real Bono?!

name: tekende
text: Nah, it just took him a few tries to find the right strip.

name: aperson
text: Hah, I forgot about this. I was so darned proud of myself even I gave 'bono' a chubby.

name: wjon
text:
Bono, according to real life, is an old lady.

I hate Bono.

name: closefriend
text: Pat's still a fan of Rod in the Morning... and the rest of the day.

name: aperson
text: ack ack ack ack.

name: i_love_kate
text: Pre-canon gay jokes around Pat put the RAGE into me for reasons I cannot fully explain. I say this as an admission of fault, not a boast or a threat.

name: heccibiggs
text:
I hate it when people comment on strips before Pat's coming out and say to every single thing he does "ohhhh well we know now that this is because he is gay...".

Not everything ever is connected to a person's sexual orientation. OKAY.

name: aperson
text: This is true; some things are connected to penis size, or menstruation.

name: aelindil
text: And in very rare cases, both!

name: carlyle
text:
Man, been there before.

But then again, we all have at least once in our life, right?

name: greenkoolayd
text: im thrilled that you didnt make a joke about getting your"red wings".  im thrilled that i wont be cleaning vomit from my laptop.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Something said immediately after this strip?

name: kotekan
text: A reference to the Urinals? Hooray!

name: brinstar
text: It's weird to see Pat take a hardline stance against crime considering he busted out of the joint.

name: rumblefish
text: An important part of being a Pat is to be utterly and completely unaware of your own failings.

name: mindbnder
text: To be fair to Pat, Bono does seem sensible.

name: soticoto
text: Seeming to be can sometimes be the exact opposite of actually being... as in Bono's case.

name: nigelchaos
text: The alt text kicks ass

name: caseyb3
text:
I think we all need one of those.

That and a Foucault slide whistle.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: and a sproing.

name: achilleselbow
text:
Looks like someone read Discipline and Punish. I always wondered what Onstad majored in at Stanford.

On another note, Pat is torn between his brutal sense of vindictiveness and his desire for approval from politically correct yuppie cultural icons. Classic dilemma.

name: hereward
text: Foucault would not have recommended this.

name: i_love_kate
text: Is it wrong that I think that Pat is raising a valid point in panel three?

name: mangtastic
text:
Probably.

I think the reason criminals don't respond to their liberty being stripped by an institution is because their liberties were already stripped by being from Circumstances. Think about it.

name: greenkoolayd
text: not so.  being from Circumstances does not prevent one from knowing that even being in Circumstances in america is like being a king in some other country.

name: mangtastic
text: True, however many many many people in america remain willfully ignorant and/or completely callous to those people in some other country.

name: ham_shoes
text: WHAT DO YOU HAVE AGAINST TV SETS

name: tekende
text: You are not wrong to think that, but I think we can all agree that public executions for crimes like theft is a bit over-the-top.

name: i_love_kate
text: [scruffy]Second.[/scruffy]

name: dartigen
text:
Well it never stopped all those people hundreds of years ago who still did crimes. (Some of them got kicked out of the country instead of executed. But it still didn't work.)
But jail doesn't seem to be stopping people either so I guess there is no solution here.

name: tekende
text: Nah. No matter what the punishment is, there will always be some people willing to take the risk in order to steal or hurt or kill or whatever. It's just something we have to live with.

name: fermatprime
text:
The U2 that Pat...

...Bono?

name: audry
text: il souffre de dépression grave...  ceci est pourquoi pat est un DICK

name: i_love_kate
text: P'tetre.

name: lolsworth
text:
Morning is Rod's surname.

In and The are his middle names

name: greenkoolayd
text: is it pronounced 'fuck-all'?

name: johnnymalo
text: "F-bomb = Foucault" is win.

name: archimedes2000
text: It is funny 'cause Pat does not want Bono to think low of him.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Pat only got halfway through the first chapter of Discipline and Punish.
